main event: An orange colored object was observed in the western sky near Loveland, Ohio on 11 November 1957.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 12 minutes,During the sighting, rays shone out from the object for about 7 minutes before it disappeared,Following its disappearance, black running lights that were sunset-colored were observed for an additional 5 minutes,Balloon release prior to the sighting may explain the observation,Local facilities confirmed a weather balloon was present before the sighting.
sighted object: orange colored object with rays and black running lights
witness description: Civilians who reported the sighting near a school.
